questions.question: Drugs work in the brain because they have similar:

choices.answer: Size and shape as natural brain chemicals

questions.title: A Closer Look...
questions.description: Drugs can “fool” the brain because they’re similar in size and shape to natural brain chemicals called neurotransmitters, so they fit into brain receptors and start an unnatural chain reaction of electrical charges.

questions.question: Because of drugs’ effects on the brain, people who use a drug over and over can develop a “tolerance” for it, meaning:

choices.answer: They need more of the drug to get the same effect
They need less of the drug to get the same effect
They get bored with using the drug

questions.question: When teens use drugs for a long time, the effects on their brains can become permanent—even if they stop using drugs.

choices.answer: They protect you from nausea and vomiting
Most of them depress the central nervous system
They send oxygen to the brain, resulting in a happy, stimulant effect

questions.title: A Closer Look...
questions.description: Nearly all inhalants (except nitrites) produce a “high” by slowing down brain activity. Nitrites, in contrast, expand and relax blood vessels.

questions.question: How does alcohol affect the teenage brain?

choices.answer: It compromises decision-making and the ability to recognize danger
It improves vision when consumed in small amounts

questions.question: The brain is vulnerable to alcohol damage while it’s developing. Until about what age does the brain keep developing?

questions.title: A Closer Look...
questions.description: Young people’s brains keep developing well into their 20s. Alcohol can alter this and affect brain structure and function, causing cognitive problems later in life. This is especially risky when people start drinking heavily while they’re young.

questions.question: Which brain area plays a role in feeling motivation and pleasure?

questions.title: A Closer Look...
questions.description: The basal ganglia plays a key role in motivation and the pleasurable effects of healthy activities like eating, socializing, and sex. Drug use can make it hard to feel pleasure from anything but the drug.

choices.answer: They shut off receptors in the occipital lobe
They cause a rise in dopamine in the limbic system

questions.question: Do you believe that using drugs can cause long-term effects on your brain?
